node.text:
Listen in as I talk with @gayleguyardotv on @bloom_tv  about 3 simple, doable tips for parents to boost their kids' immune system and keep them healthy & happy all year long! 
.
Short but sweet (no pun intended! 😜). Be sure to tag and share with any mama who could benefit! 🥰
.
Let's thrive in 2021. We're all in this together!💗

xo Holistic mama doc - Elisa Song, MD💕

node.title: 💥3 Tips to Raise Healthy Happy Kids in 2021!💥

node.text:
On PANS/PANDAS Awareness Day, I want to honor the families living with this devastating illness, and spread awareness about how to make sure PANS/PANDAS isn't missed! I'm sharing my story of my near-miss with Bodi and how I believe I truly believe I dodged the PANDAS-bullet for him. I don't want any child to have to suffer needlessly.
.
Be sure to check out the PANS/PANDAS Parent Panel I hosted last year with my amazing mamas, and a papa(!), in my practice who shared their wins, challenges, and game changers:
https://www.facebook.com/DrElisaSongMD/videos/2138594259734194/
.
If you want more information, I had the honor to share my integrative functional medicine approach to  PANS/PANDAS on 2 amazing podcasts with my friends, Andrew Whitfield-Cook and Dr. Kara Fitzgeraled. You can find them here (links are also in my bio): My 2-part interview on the @fxmedicine Fx Medicine Australia podcast:
http://www.fxmedicine.com.au/content/integrative-paediatrics-pandas-part-1-dr-elisa-song
http://www.fxmedicine.com.au/content/integrative-paediatrics-pandas-part-2-dr-elisa-song .
My interview on the @drkarafitzgerald New Frontiers in Functional Medicine podcast:
https://www.drkarafitzgerald.com/2019/07/13/functional-medicine-pediatrician-dr-elisa-song-pans-pandas-dx-treatment/
.
Love to you all,
xo Holistic mama doc - Elisa Song, MD💕

node.text:
Kenzi & Bodi go back to school tomorrow - gulp!😳 Full-days, 5 days/week, for the first time in 18 months ...

Back-to-school means back-to-germs. Only now, we’re facing not just Delta, but all the “normal” bugs that come with the start of the school year. And many of you have asked me what I’m doing to support my kids’ immune systems - so let me share it all!

Mamas need to know how to support our kids’ immune systems and build IMMUNE RESILIENCE, no matter what comes their way. And we need to know NOW!

💥Remember - Immune Resilience doesn’t mean never getting sick.
💥Immune Resilience means the ability to take a hit - whether it’s an infection, psychologic stress or toxin - and not just recover rapidly & completely, but bounce back even STRONGER for the next hit. 

👉You can build Immune Resilience in your kids with these 6 SIMPLE STRATEGIES:
 
💤Restorative sleep. Sleep increases the ability of your white blood cells to fight viral infections
⛹🏻‍♀️Move your body. Moderate daily exercise boosts your white blood cells’ ability to clear germs
🍭Cut the sugar. Sugar reduces your white blood cells’ ability to fight infection by 50%!
🧘🏻‍♂️Don’t worry. Be happy. Our immune system doesn’t know the difference between physical or psychological stress - they both create inflammation & weaken our defenses.
🍎Food as medicine. For immune-boosting punch, load up on foods rich in these Superpower Immune Nutrients: Zinc, Quercetin, Vit C, Glutathione, Vit D, Vit A, probiotics and omega-3 essential fatty acids. 👉Download my FREE GUIDE for your superfood shopping guide HERE [LINK IN BIO]: https://healthykidshappykids.com/food-medicine-coronavirus/ 
🎯Targeted supplements. I’ve taken the guesswork out of what your family needs with my Kids’ and Adults’ Immune Support kits. Learn more HERE [LINK IN BIO]: https://store.healthykidshappykids.com/product-category/brands/healthy-kids-happy-kids-kits/

Why focus on these super immune-boosting nutrients?
[📌SEE COMMENT BELOW]

node.text:
Never shame another mama. Ever.

I am seeing so much shaming & blaming by mamas, of other mamas, and it is breaking my heart.💔

Before you shame & blame, remember … 
You DON’T know her story …

✨You don’t see her immunosuppressed son who would be wiped out by even a common cold.

✨You don’t see her daughter who developed post-vaccine acute disseminated encephalomyelitis and now must live with multiple sclerosis for the rest of her life.

✨You don’t see her toddler who is struggling with language development and can’t learn to communicate when others wear a mask. 

✨You don’t see her teen who tried to kill herself, and just wants to hang out with her friends.

✨You don’t see her, caring for elderly mother with metastatic cancer, worried that every hug & kiss from her child could be the one that brings COVID home.

✨You don’t see her, raising her kids alone after losing their father to COVID, despite being young, fit, healthy & doing everything “right.”

🔎You don’t see her …

💗Her story is hers to live and tell💗
💗Without judgment💗
💗Without shame💗

We give ourselves enough mom guilt. Don’t give her any more …

The weight on our shoulders is heavy. Never before have most of us had to make such monumental decisions that could alter the trajectory of our kids’ health & lives. Deciding which preschool to send Kenzi to felt monumental enough. But that pales in comparison to the decisions we are now being asked to make.

We could always transfer Kenzi to another school. 
But some decisions you can’t take back …

As parents, we bear the weighty burden of living with the potentially lifelong consequences of our decisions for our children. 

These decisions are ours to make, and ours to live with. 

Remember, this is HER story.
Not yours. 

See her. Understand her. Love her. Respect her decisions for her own children.
Or just walk away.

But never, ever shame her …

xo Elisa Song, MD💕

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Elisa Song, MD on August 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Ask Dr. Song Back-to-School with Delta How worried should parents be? Dr. Elisa Song, MD Healthy Kids Happy Kids'.

node.text:
As kids get ready to go back-to-school, so many parents are wondering how worried they should be about Delta. 

💥The truth is - no one really knows.
But we probably don’t need to be as worried about Delta in our kids as the media portrays.

💥The truth is - most kids need to be IN school, IN person. 

The socioemotional, psychological, physiologic, academic & financial losses to so many children and their families can NOT be repeated another year.

❓So what do we know about Delta & kids so far?

🔎More kids are getting INFECTED with Delta.
But that does NOT mean that more kids are getting SICKER with Delta.

🔎Yes, child hospitalization numbers are going up, because child cases are going up. But the RATE of child hospitalizations & death is NOT going up. And with the likely high UNKNOWN number of children infected, but NOT tested & confirmed, the actual RISK of serious child COVID may be even LOWER.

➡️We need BETTER child COVID-19 data.
But the data we currently have does NOT show that Delta is more serious for children.

💗I don’t have all the answers. And I am on this journey with you, as my 9 and 11 year old’s head back to school next week. As Delta ramps up and many parents are unsure what this next stage of the pandemic and back-to-school means for their children, I am even more committed to providing you the support you need to navigate the pandemic with CALM and CONFIDENCE, using FACTS over FEAR. 

👉Make sure you’re signed up for my newsletter (www.healthykidshappykids.com) to get my article coming out soon on how to Get Your Child’s Immune System Ready for Back-to-School in a Pandemic. 

💪To have even MORE tools to support your child’s immune system & know what to do if they get sick, register for my online course, “Integrative & Functional Medicine Strategies for the Pandemic.” Learn more HERE [LINK IN BIO]: 
https://store.healthykidshappykids.com/product-category/brands/healthy-kids-happy-kids-education/

💪And if you want even MORE support from me, I’m continuing LIVE ZOOM UPDATES through the end of 2021 for anyone who signs up for VIP Access to the course.

💗We’re (still) in this together.💗
 
xo Elisa Song, MD💕

node.text:
What’s my biggest regret with my mom, who passed just one short year ago?

❓That I didn’t ASK her more questions.

And now I’ll never know:
✨Her favorite color
✨Her favorite food
✨Her funniest memory
✨Her saddest memory
✨Her proudest moment
✨Her greatest aspiration
✨Her biggest regret

🤔I’ll never know why she came to America - maybe it was her infatuation with Elvis …🤷🏻‍♀️

Born in Seoul, Korea, my mom braved her way to the United States at the tender age of 24. She grew up in South Korea during the Korean War where she fought over scraps of chicken meat with her sister, followed the war front peddling chewing gum and whatever she could from the American GI’s, became a high school backstroke champion holding the national record for decades, graduated as 1 of only 6 women from the prestigious Yonsei University College of Medicine, traveled halfway around the world to do her OBGYN residency in New York, started a solo thriving private practice, and worked tirelessly without complaint to raise her 3 children in the suburbs of New Jersey with all the comforts she never had growing up so that her daughters could pursue their dreams and passions with nothing to hold them back.

Family was everything to my mom. Even in her last days of valiantly fighting the cancer that would too quickly take her life, she held on with courage, humor & calm until every member of her family was able to travel far & wide to be with her during her last moments, even in the middle of a pandemic. 

I know so much about what she DID - about the legacy of grit, resilience & courage she left behind.

But I know so little about the person behind that legacy. What actually gave her the grit, resilience and courage to be able to leave the legacy that she did? What was the secret to her success? And how can I possibly follow in her footsteps if I don’t know … 

🙏I guess I can only try …

And in my dreams, my mom tells me that:
💄Her favorite color is red
🍲 Her favorite food is any kind of soup
👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Her proudest moment is watching her girls become mothers, and
🔥 The secret to her success is that no matter what happened, she just kept going …

xo Dr. Elisa Song, MD💕

node.text:
I believe that those with prior infection should be considered immune. 

👉To learn why, read my new in-depth, evidence-based article “Why Natural Immunity Should (Must) Count” HERE [LINK IN BIO]: 
https://healthykidshappykids.com/2021/07/24/why-natural-immunity-should-must-count/ 

In my article, you’ll learn:
✅The science behind why natural immunity should count
✅If those with past infection still need a vaccine
✅How to know if you’ve had a prior infection (even if it was asymptomatic or mild, or  was maybe over a year ago)
✅How this important policy shift in counting natural immunity may help reduce serious adverse vaccine reactions and help support a global response to end the pandemic

(As always, your and your child’s unique situation should be discussed in partnership with your physician.)

As Delta ramps up and many parents are unsure what this next stage of the pandemic and back-to-school means for their children, I am even more committed to providing you a balanced, evidence-based perspective on all the important issues that have come up for us as parents during the pandemic. And now more than ever, I am here to support you with the calm, rational, and science-backed information you need to make the most informed decisions for you and your family. We are (still) all in this together.

xo Elisa Song, MD💕

node.text:
Just because you can, doesn’t mean you should …

Just because your kids can, doesn’t mean they should …
🚫Jump off the top of the slide
🚫Stick M&M’s up their nose
🚫Whack their little brother with a Lego
🚫Eat a pound of marshmallows

You get the idea ...

🎯One of the most important predictors for success in adulthood is having SELF-CONTROL as a child.

💥The ability to STOP and THINK, before you ACT. 

🤦🏻‍♀️I was just discussing this with Bodi after he decided to lick the salt off the lid of the pot that I had just popped popcorn in … 

Several studies over the years have found that children with lower self-control are more likely than those with higher self-control to have chronic health problems as adults, and less likely to be successful financially, academically, and socio-emotionally. And these differences persist even after controlling for other important variables that predict success - like IQ and socio-economic status.

❓So how do we instill self-control in our children?

✅Model self-control ourselves! Practice the “Power of the Pause” and show your kids how to:
🚫Stop
🤔Think
🧘🏻‍♂️Breathe
👍Then Act

(The Power of the Pause is especially important when we’re frustrated, annoyed, angry, overwhelmed, embarrassed, scared, disappointed, overexcited, or experiencing any other emotion that can overtake us and cause us to want to explode.)

✅Have clear and consistent rules for what is appropriate and have high expectations for your child’s behaviors. Be supportive and loving, yet firm. Respond immediately to reinforce the behaviors that you expect, and support your children positively in their efforts to practice self-control. 

✅Be patient and persistent. Remember, while self-control may be easy for some children, it must be learned by others. Even many of us parents could use more practice, including me!

xo Elisa Song, MD💕

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Elisa Song, MD on July 20, 2021. May be an image of 2 people and nature.

node.text:
🥰 I would do almost anything for this guy. 

🌈🦄 I would give him rainbows and unicorns everyday if I could. 

🌎 I would fly to the ends of the earth if he needed me. 

❓But what’s the one thing I won’t do?

❌ I won’t shield him from every hurt, fear, worry, frustration or embarrassment. 
❌ I won’t make everything “right” every time something goes wrong.

💗I won’t protect him from failing.💗

🎁Failing is one of the most beautiful gifts we can give our children. As long as we show them how to fail and get back up again. As long as we model how to learn from our failures and come back even stronger, smarter, faster, better than before. 

💥As long as we teach them to Fail Forward.💥

I’ve failed a thousand times before. And I’m confident I’ll fail a thousand times more. 

Failing forward has made me a better Mother. Wife. Friend. Sister. Daughter. 

Failing forward has made me a better Doctor. Business owner. Entrepreneur.

If you never try, you’ll never fail.
But you also won’t ever succeed. 

💗Life is hard.
💗Life is messy.
💗Life is beautiful.

Don’t be afraid to fail,
But always Fail Forward …

xo Elisa Song, MD💕

🍭🍪🍦🍰🍬Are you a closet sugar addict? And you don’t want your kids to know? Because you don’t want them to follow in your footsteps, but you’re not sure how to stop the cravings?
 
If you’re like me, as we emerge from this holiday weekend after BBQs and the requisite red-white-blue jello, ice cream and popsicles, you’re asking yourself how on earth you let yourself overindulge, AGAIN … You promised to be “good” this time. And you promised to model healthy eating behaviors to your kids. 
 
But …
 
😈The sugar cravings are just too hard to resist …
 
❓Do you suspect you’re addicted to sugar?
❓Is eating too much sugar making you feel tired, sick and depressed?
❓Do you wish you could stop sugar cravings for good?
 
It’s not your fault! Studies have shown that sugar is actually more addictive than cocaine!
 
And sugar is EVERYWHERE - even in that organic jar of spaghetti sauce!
 
If you find it hard to say “no” to the sweet stuff,  it’s likely compromising  your health goals. Not only that, studies have found that sugar reduces your white blood cell’s abilities to kill germs by 50% - and that effect lasts at least 5 hours! 
 
With back-to-school germs around the corner, it’s time to get control of our (and our kids’) sugar cravings once and for all
 
❇️Join me for this special FREE Masterclass, where my dear friend and Emotional Eating Expert, @tricianelson_ , and I will share: 
 
3 Secrets to Stopping Sugar Cravings NOW 
When: Friday, July 9th at 10am PT (1pm ET)
 
👉Click here to register now [LINK IN BIO]: https://xj108.isrefer.com/go/3secrets/esong/
 
What you will learn:
 
✅Why sugar is so addictive
✅3 Simple ways to stop your sugar cravings
✅Why “moderation” may not be working for you
❎The #1 key to enjoying your food, without loading on the sugar
✅The secret to ending sugar binges…for good!
 
Mark your calendar and kick the sugar habit! Don’t miss this important class that will show you how to finally break free from sugar’s grip!
 
👉Save your spot here: https://xj108.isrefer.com/go/3secrets/esong/
 
Hope to see you there!
xo Elisa Song, MD💕
 
P.S. Tag and share with your mama friends - they may be more hooked on sugar than you know and will thank you!

node.text:
💗Kenzi (as I’m kissing her goodnight): Mama - can you close my closet door?

💗Me: OK, baby.

💗Kenzi: Oh wait, never mind. I forgot I’m not scared of the closet anymore ...
.
.
.
😳Fear - it’s a funny thing. Our brain can make fears grow bigger & bigger until we’re paralyzed. And just like that, our brain can make them disappear. 

Fear may be based on something real & dangerous. 

But most often, fears are based on something vague. Something that could happen, but is not likely to happen. Fear is actually F.E.A.R.:

False
Evidence
Appearing 
Real

How many times has F.E.A.R. held you back from doing something because you thought you would fail? You thought you weren’t good enough, smart enough, strong enough. So you never try. And you never succeed. And your F.E.A.R. is confirmed in your mind to be true. 

F.E.A.R. is your brain trying to protect you, so that you never experience failure. But guess what?

If you never fail, you never succeed …

🎂As I enter my 51st year, Kenzi has given me one of the most precious gifts.

🎁A reminder that while we can’t necessarily control how we feel, we have the power to choose how we think and act. We have the power to put F.E.A.R. in its place and move forward with calm & confidence. 

💗So on my 51st year, I am committed to being here with you through whatever comes next. To help you fight F.E.A.R with facts and make decisions for your child with calm & confidence.This past year and a half, our lives have been ruled by fear. Some of that fear was warranted, but a lot has been F.E.A.R.. And I for one am DONE with F.E.A.R.
 
❇️That’s why I wrote my article, Should Kids Get a COVID-19 Vaccine? A pediatrician’s perspective [LINK IN BIO]:
https://healthykidshappykids.com/2021/06/14/should-kids-get-a-covid-19-vaccine/

❇️And that’s why I’m holding a Masterclass on COVID-19 Vaccines & Kids: What a Pediatrician Wants You to Know. Spaces will be limited, so be sure you’re signed up for my Healthy Kids Happy Kids newsletter [LINK IN BIO]  https://healthykidshappykids.com/) to know when registration begins. 

💪Here’s to FACTS over F.E.A.R.

xo Elisa Song, MD💕
